dmv.spring.demo.model.repository

Interface UserRepository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UserRepositoryComboQueries, UserRepositoryExceptionAdapter

    public interface UserRepository
    CRUD operations for User entity. For all methods where receiving the User object as a parameter user id field is mandatory, otherwise that user can't be treated.
    Author:
    dmv

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User create(User user)
      Will store new user on persistence layer.
      void delete(User user)
      Will delete existing user (found by id) from persistence layer
      User findByEmail(java.lang.String email)
      Find user by e-mail address.
      User findById(java.lang.Long id)
      Find user by its unique identifier.
      User getCredentials(java.lang.String email)
      Find user by email address and return with that email and password fields only.
      User update(User user)
      Will update existing user (found by id) with given user details (password and email fields are omitted, these are different operations).

    • Method Detail

      • findById

        User findById(java.lang.Long id)
        Find user by its unique identifier. Will return existing user or throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        id - User's id
        Returns:
        User with given id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null
        EntityDoesNotExistException - if user can't be found
        AccessDataBaseException - if operation was unsuccessful due to internal error

      • findByEmail

        User findByEmail(java.lang.String email)
        Find user by e-mail address. Will return existing user or throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        email - email address
        Returns:
        User with given address
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null
        EntityDoesNotExistException - if user can't be found
        AccessDataBaseException - if operation was unsuccessful due to internal error

      • create

        User create(User user)
        Will store new user on persistence layer. Id will be generated and returned.

        User constraints: fields 'email', 'first name' and 'last name' must be provided; 'email' must be unique. If password was not given it will be generated and returned with the created object.

        For user's roles only 'shortName' parameter is needed. If it is absent or the role with given name does not exist in database the IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        user - A new user to persist
        Returns:
        persisted user on success
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if user or its id is null or user has incomplete or wrong information
        EntityAlreadyExistsException - if user with the same email already exists
        AccessDataBaseException - if operation was unsuccessful due to internal error

      • update

        User update(User user)
        Will update existing user (found by id) with given user details (password and email fields are omitted, these are different operations).

        For user's roles only 'shortName' parameter is needed. If it is absent or the role with given name does not exist in database the IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        user - An existing user with new profile
        Returns:
        true update was successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if user or its id is null or user has incomplete or wrong information
        EntityDoesNotExistException - if user can't be found
        AccessDataBaseException - if operation was unsuccessful due to internal error

      • delete

        void delete(User user)
        Will delete existing user (found by id) from persistence layer
        Parameters:
        user - An existing user
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if user or its id is null
        EntityDoesNotExistException - if user can't be found
        AccessDataBaseException - if operation was unsuccessful due to internal error

      • getCredentials

        User getCredentials(java.lang.String email)
        Find user by email address and return with that email and password fields only. For authentication purposes.
        Parameters:
        email - User's identifier, unique email address
        Returns:
        User with email and password if exists
        Throws:
        EntityDoesNotExistException - if user can't be found
